title: Android app crashes even while not edited, how can I solve it?
content:
Installed an application from google playstore and then transferred to it my computer to apparently edit it and without any changes I made to it then I tried to install it through ADB, well the installation was fine but When I tried to start the application it just crashes. also tried to clear app data to see any solution but it didn't work! and when I look into the logcat I find the following which is almost informative except this vague error  

04-02 17:15:29.095  3053  3071 E AndroidRuntime: Process: com.ibsbankmobile, PID: 3053

all other logcat is below:


the app in question can be found here

can anyone tell or explain to me what is going wrong here? and how can I circumvent it?

any help would be appreciated

comments.text: Does the app crash when installed normally? If not, then you changed something important during the transfer process even if you did not patch the binary.

answers_data.content:
```
W System  : ClassLoader referenced unknown path: /data/app/com.ibsbankmobile-1/lib/arm64

E AndroidRuntime: Process: com.ibsbankmobile, PID: 3053

```
The warning here shows that you have a missing path: /data/app/.../lib/arm64

This directory contains binary (compiled) libraries that belong to the app. If you repack an app, whether you changed its code or not, you have to make sure that you pack, and sign, these files.

comments.text: thank you for the clarification but How can I pack, and sign, these files plz?
This is not a straightforward process and it takes some time. Repack: ibotpeaches.github.io/Apktool/documentation Sign: developer.android.com/studio/publish/â€¦
@Yomtamz , Specifically how can I sign binary (compiled) libraries  of the app, should I use Jarsigner?
You don't have to sign individual files, you just have to make sure that they are included in the new JAR (or APK) when you sign it with "jarsigner".
sorry for my noobness, it is true the lib  folder is not there on the app but can you tell me how can I put it there or should I pull from the android device?
